intro: Stephania cleomoides, commonly known as the slender beggar's-tick, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by distinctive, winged fruits. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. The botanical features of Stephania cleomoides make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical studies.
